answerText: pH[10] pH is technically equal to the negative log of this quantity, represented gamma, but is replaced by concentration since its coefficient is assumed to be 1. That coefficient can also be given by the Debye-Huckel equation.
heading: ACF Winter |2009 | Minnesota A and Dartmouth A and South Detroit University | 4 | Science | Chemistry | College
subject: Science
question: Question: A special case of this quantity, at which a compound has zero net charge, is called the isoelectric point. For 10 points each:  [10] Identify this quantity, which is equal to the negative log of the dissociation constant plus log of the concentration of conjugate base over acid according to the Henderson-Hasselbalch equation
